results.title: The Winning breed
results.brief_description: The film looks at the breeding of thoroughbred racehorses. Important factors in breeding are discussed and the film surveys some of the activities and a variety of horses which are found in several Australian stud farms owned by Wright Stevensons.

results.title: The Wings of eagles
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Charles Schnee and John Ford
results.brief_description: The story is based on the life of Spig Wead, a pioneer aviator, renowned screenwriter. He scripted two of Ford’s films and was a personal friend. Spig is unable to combine his career and marriage. The exuberance of the early scenes of inter-service rivalry and the pursuit of glory rings hollow in what is basically an unattractive portrait of military life. Following the breakdown of his marriage and a crippling accident, Wead is overtaken by a profound sense of failure and loss. Cast includes John Wayne, Dan Dailey, Maureen O’Hara, Ward Bond.

results.title: The Winged scourge
results.brief_description: Points out that the Anopheles mosquito alone transmits malaria and shows its development from the larva to full growth when it becomes a menace. Various means of combating the mosquito are demonstrated.

results.title: The Winged go-betweens
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Scientific and Educational Film Studio and Miu Chin
results.brief_description: A nature film on the life of bees, concentrating in particular on their most useful function - the pollination of flowers. Using close-ups the camera reveals the work and behaviour of these insects in a way rarely seen before on the screen. A fascinating insight into their world.

results.title: The Windwheel
results.brief_description: The windwheel is a short animated story of a girl and her father at a fun park. It was drawn entirely under the camera by Susan Stamp using charcoal as the primary drawing medium. The story follows the father and his daughter as they share the sights, sounds and rides of the fun park. When she is given a small windwheel, the girl is delighted and plays happily until her father is accidentally knocked in the eye by it.

results.title: The Winds of Jarrah
results.creator_credit: Film Corporation of Western Australia, Mark Egerton and Marj Pearson
results.brief_description: Based on a Harlequin/Mills and Boon novel “The house in the timberwoods” by Joyce Dingwell. Set in Australia in 1946, it is the story of an English governess employed by the wealthy boss of a timber empire. He and his three children harbour a deep mistrust of women and she is befriended by one of the many returned servicemen in the timberlands. Stars Terence Donovan and Susan Lyons, supported by Harold Hopkins, Steve Bisley and Martin Vaughan.

results.title: The Winds of Fogo
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Colin Low
results.brief_description: Fogo is a windswept island off the coast of Newfoundland where the inhabitants have lived by, on and from the sea. A fisherman and his sons take a day off from the nets for a journey to the gannet colony on the Funk Islands, fifty miles farther out to sea. There are exceptional close-up views of enormous flocks of seabirds swarming the cliffs and the sky.

results.title: The Wind on the Heath
results.creator_credit: Cecil Musk, Leon Bijon and Peter Jessop
results.brief_description: Explores places of scenic beauty and historic interest amid the mountains and valleys of Britain’s ten National Parks. Against the background of river, mountain and mooorland landscape of river, mountain and moorland landscape, some of the pastimes available to all in the Parks are shown, including climbing in Snowdonia, skiing, and boating on the lakes, and hiking or pony trekking on the moors.

results.title: The Wind in the willows (K)
results.creator_credit: Cosgrove-Hall Productions, Mark Hall and Brian Cosgrove
results.brief_description: An enchanting puppet musical that captures the beauty of the English countryside and a way of life that disappeared with the decline of the British Empire. The film features favourite characters; Rat, Mole, Badger and Toad of Toad Hall. Based on the story by Kenneth Grahame and adapted by Rosemary Anne Sisson.

results.title: The Wind in the willows
results.creator_credit: TVC London, HIT Entertainment Pictures, Carlton UK, John Coates and Dave Unwin
results.brief_description: Narrated by Vanessa Redgrave, this is an animated adaptation of Kenneth Grahame’s children’s classic “The Wind in the willows.” The adventures of Mole, Rat, Badger and Toad have delighted children for generations. Animated by the team who created “The World of Peter Rabbit and friends”, this production features the voices of Rik Mayall as Toad, Michael Palin as Rat, Alan Bennett as Mole and Michael Gambon as Badger.
